member.name: M:Dundas.Olap.Data.CubeDataSchema.FindMemberByUniqueName(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds dimension object by its unique name.
member.remarks: This method finds the Member by iterating through each member of each Dimension, Hierarchy and Level. This operation may take a significant amount of time, especially if the information about the Level members is not yet preloaded into the CubeDataSchema object. Set the loadedMembersOnly property to true to search only in the levels that have their members already loaded.
member.param: Indicates that a search is performed on the preloaded members only.
member.returns: Dimension object or null if not found.

member.name: T:Dundas.Olap.Data.MemberSortingAndFiltering
member.summary: Represents dimension member sorting and filtering rules in the object.
member.remarks:
Filtering allows the user to remove members that do not match the specified criteria. Criteria is defined using the , , and properties.
Top/bottom filtering allows the user to remove all members except the specified number of top/bottom members. The property defines if top or bottom members are kept. The property defines the number or percentage of members kept depending on the property. The property controls whether the hierarchy will be broken as a result of filtering.
Sorting allows the user to order members ascendingly or descendingly using one of the measure names. The order is defined by the property. The property defines the measure name. The property controls if the hierarchy will be broken as a result of sorting.

member.name: P:Dundas.Olap.Data.MemberSortingAndFiltering.FilterTopBottomBreaksHierarchy
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag that indicates if top/bottom filtering breaks dimension hierarchy.
member.value: True if top/bottom filtering breaks dimension hierarchy.

member.name: P:Dundas.Olap.Data.MemberSortingAndFiltering.FilterTopBottomType
member.summary: Gets or sets top/bottom filtering type.
member.remarks: To enable top/bottom filtering, set this property to either FilterTopBottomType.Top or FilterTopBottomType.Bottom and specify the property. The number or percent of top/bottom members shown can be controlled by using the and properties.
member.value: A enumeration value that indicates if top, bottom or no filtering is enabled.

member.name: P:Dundas.Olap.Data.MemberSortingAndFiltering.FilterTopBottomValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the number or percentage of top/bottom members to be displayed.
member.remarks: Top/bottom filtering can filter using the member count or percentage of their values. The property controls this behaviour.
member.value: A double that contains either the number or percentage of top/bottom members.

member.name: P:Dundas.Olap.Data.MemberSortingAndFiltering.FilterTopBottomValueType
member.summary: Gets or sets if the top/bottom members are counted using the count or percentage.
member.remarks: Top/bottom filtering can filter using member count or percentage of their values based on this property. The property defines the actual number/percent of members shown.
member.value: A double that contains either the number or the percentage of top/bottom members.

member.name: P:Dundas.Olap.Data.MemberSortingAndFiltering.FilterTopBottomMeasure
member.summary: Gets or sets the measure name used for top/bottom filtering.
member.value: A string that contains measure name used for filtering.

member.name: P:Dundas.Olap.Data.MemberSortingAndFiltering.FilterCondition
member.summary: Gets or sets a filtering condition.
member.remarks:
Use this property to enable or disable filtering and to specify the filtering condition. Use the and properties to specify condition values. Most of the conditions (excluding Between and NotBetween) only use one condition value.
property must be set to measure name which is used in the filter.
member.value: A enumeration value that indicates if filtering is enabled and what filtering condition is used.

member.name: P:Dundas.Olap.Data.MemberSortingAndFiltering.FilterMeasure
member.summary: Gets or sets a measure name used to filter members.
member.value: A string that contains a measure name used to filter members.

member.name: P:Dundas.Olap.Data.MemberSortingAndFiltering.FilterValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the first value of the filtering condition.
member.remarks: Filtering conditions Between and NotBetween use two values. Use the property to specify the second value.
member.value: A double that contains the first value of the filtering condition.

member.name: P:Dundas.Olap.Data.MemberSortingAndFiltering.FilterValue2
member.summary: Gets or sets the second value of the filtering condition.
member.remarks: The second filtering value is only used in conjunction with the Between and NotBetween conditions. For all other conditions, please use the property.
member.value: A double that contains the second value of the filtering condition.

member.name: P:Dundas.Olap.Data.MemberSortingAndFiltering.SortOrder

member.name: T:Dundas.Olap.Data.DimensionDescriptor
member.summary: Represents one or more dimensions on the axis used to retrieve data from the data provider.
member.remarks: The DimensionDescriptor represents one or more dimensions in the object. To identify the dimension, its name must be specified as the property. In addition, default and collection may be provided. If the level is not specified, the first level of the dimension will be used. If the member collection is not specified, all members of the level will be used.

member.name: P:Dundas.Olap.Data.Hierarchy.DisplayFolder
member.summary: Gets or sets the Hierarchy display folder name.
member.value: A String that contains the Hierarchy display folder name.
member.remarks:
The DisplayFolder property contains the fully qualified name of the display folder in which hierarchy appears. It consists of one or many display folder names that represent the path to the hierarchy . If the display folders are nested, the property lists the name of each display folder the parent folder contains, separated by backslash characters '\'.
If hierarchy do not have associated display folder, this property contains an empty string.
